Package breakout

Class UIElements

java.lang.Object
breakout.UIElements
public class UIElements
extends java.lang.Object
This class is used to generate all the UI elements that are used in the game.

  • Constructor Details

    • UIElements

      public UIElements()

  • Method Details

    • createMainSplashScreen

      public javafx.scene.Scene createMainSplashScreen()
      The main splashscreen welcomes the player and tells them how to play.
      Returns:
      A scene object containing all main splashscreen information.

    • createFailureScreen

      public javafx.scene.Scene createFailureScreen​(int score)
      The failure screen appears when the player runs out of lives. It displays their score.
      Parameters:
      score - The score of the player.
      Returns:
      A scene object containing all failure screen information.

    • createEndSplashScreen

      public javafx.scene.Scene createEndSplashScreen​(int score) throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
      The end splashscreen appears if the player has won and beat all the levels in the game. It also shows the highest ever score so that they will be tempted to replay to beat the high score.
      Parameters:
      score - The score obtained by the player in the current game run.
      Returns:
      A scene containing all information if player has won.
      Throws:
      java.io.FileNotFoundException - Returned if high score text file is not found.

    • createText

      public javafx.scene.text.Text createText​(java.lang.String s, int font, int x, int y)
      Text objects are created in this method for modularity purposes. They are used in Levels to attach a text object to a scene so that they may be easily updated information changes.
      Parameters:
      s - String passed in that is displayed in the scene.
      font - Set the size of the font.
      x - The x parameter represents horizontal location and is used to set location on the scene.
      y - The y parameter represents vertical location and is used to set location on the scene.
      Returns:
      Returns a Text object containing all the info about the text created.

    • updateText

      public void updateText​(javafx.scene.text.Text t, java.lang.String s)
      This method is used to update the string displayed in a text object.
      Parameters:
      t - Text object to determine which object to change.
      s - String that you want to update the text object to now contain.

    • setHighestScore

      public void setHighestScore​(int gameScore) throws java.io.IOException
      This method is used externally when the game finished to set the highest score in the text file if the current game score is truly the high score.
      Parameters:
      gameScore - Current game score.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - Thrown if high score text file is not found.
